full_text: Screened by 9/25/2023 ADOPTION DECREE: Provide a certified copy of the adoption decree of If the document is in a foreign language, then an English translation must also be provided. ADOPTION-TWO YEAR RESIDENCE: Service regulations provide classification thru an adoption only where the adopted child has resided with the adopting parents for a period of two years. Such residence may have been before or after the actual adoption decree became final. Resubmit the petition together with evidence that the adopted child resided with the adoptive parent(s) for the requisite two year period. LEGAL NAME CHANGE: Submit evidence of the legal name change of to . Any foreign language document must be accompanied by an English translation. NAME DIFFERENCE: Different names are shown on the documents provided. If it is your contention that and are one and the same person, then resubmit the petition with documentary evidence to support that contention. DIVORCE/DEATH DECREE: Submit a certified copy of the divorce or death decree which legally terminated the prior marriage of and Any foreign language documents must be accompanied by an English transiation. EXAMPLES OF ACCEPTABLE SECONDARY EVIDENCE: This evidence will generally only be considered when primary evidence is not available. for birth, marriage, divorce or death records. RELIGIOUS - - baptismal certificates, Church marriage records, Bible entries, family church registers, or any other religious document to show relationship. MEDICAL - hospital birth records, doctor or midwife records of birth. or any other medical records showing the relationship. GOVERNMENT - census records, or documents from other government agencies indicating the alleged relationship: eg. military, social security, income tax. SCHOOL - school reports listing the student's name, and names of parents, includes diplomas and other school records to establish the claimed relationship. CORRESPONDENCE - old letters which indicate the relationship. PHOTOGRAPHS - of any of the event in question, or which tend to prove the relationship Any photos provided should be accompanied by statement, describing the date place, and persons portrayed in the photograph. BUSINESS RECORDS - such as insurance policies, or other documents showing the relat- ionship claimed. PASSPORT/TRAVEL DOCUMENTS/IDENTIFICATION CARDS NOTE: The above list are only examples. Any evidence which is provided will be considered before a final decision is made on the petition.
